questions.text: Major Pat Reid made a famous escape from which POW camp ?
questions.explanation:
Colditz.

	Colditz is located about 30 miles south west of Leipzig. It was a WWII prisioner of war camp, from which some very daring escapes were made.

questions.text: The first law on record, about 2100BC, was made to ban what?
questions.explanation:
Witchcraft.

	Making it the world's oldest illegal activity... I guess.

questions.text: Right up to 1819, what was the maximum penalty for illegal tree felling in the United Kingdom ?
questions.explanation:
Hanging.

	But then how could you be hanged if you chopped down all the trees?

questions.text: To whom was given the title of 'The Shrieking Sisterhood'?
questions.explanation:
The suffragettes.

	This movement did much for the advancement of women in general.

questions.text: How many prisioners were in the Bastille on the day it was stormed ?
questions.explanation:
7.

	I guess word had got round.

questions.text: In which conflict was the General Belgrano sunk ?
questions.explanation:
The Falklands War.

	This small war took place in 1982, between Britain and Argentina, over the disputed South Atlantic Islands.

questions.text: Before World War I, who wrote a serious book on how to recognize German spies by their walk ?
questions.explanation:
Robert Baden Powell.

	Robert Baden Powell(1857-1941)was a British soldier and founder of the Boy Scouts.

questions.text: Who was King of England during the Addled Parliament ?
options: There was no king, Cromwell was in charge
questions.explanation:
James I.

	James I was the son of Mary Queen of Scots and cousin of Elizabeth I of England. His harsh treatment of Catholics led to the Gunpowder Plot in 1605.

questions.text: Who allegedly appointed his horse Incitatus a consul?
questions.explanation:
Caligula.

	Caligula was, among other things, quite mad of course.

questions.text: Why, in 1896 and 1897 did the English Royal Mint make three times as many copper coins as in the previous year ?
questions.correct: To feed the new fangled gas meters
options: Because of a severe shortage of silver
To feed the new fangled telephone booths
questions.explanation:
To feed the new fangled gas meters.

	Ah the price of progress.
